meanings.definition: The act of making something or someone appear more attractive or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The glamorization of the old car in the movie made it look shiny and new.
meanings.sent2: The magazine's glamorization of the celebrity's lifestyle influenced many young fans.
meanings.sent3: The glamorization of the messy room as 'vintage chic' was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her glamorization of the mundane task turned it into a glamorous adventure.
meanings.sent5: The glamorization of the plain dress with sparkles made it unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The portrayal of something in a way that makes it seem more exciting or appealing.
meanings.sent1: The glamorization of the camping trip in the brochure made it look like a grand adventure.
meanings.sent2: The movie's glamorization of the detective's job made it seem thrilling and dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The glamorization of the school cafeteria food as gourmet cuisine was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His glamorization of the small town as a bustling city was quite striking.
meanings.sent5: The glamorization of the rainy day as a cozy reading opportunity was vivid and memorable.
